CORE_IT_OPERATIONS.Foundational: Core systems lack consistency and reliability, leading to outages and unpredictable service quality. Improving operational discipline will reduce disruption risk and free staff from constant reactive work.
CORE_IT_OPERATIONS.Developing: Systems are generally stable but operational practices vary widely between teams. Increasing standardisation will reduce manual effort, lower incident rates, and improve service efficiency.
CORE_IT_OPERATIONS.Established: Operational processes are reliable but still depend on manual checks and inconsistent monitoring. Expanding automation will reduce operational risk and improve long-term cost control.
CORE_IT_OPERATIONS.Advanced: Operations are stable and mostly automated, but visibility gaps still create reactive work. Enhancing observability will reduce downtime, improve performance, and support scalable growth.
CORE_IT_OPERATIONS.Optimised: Operations are fully standardised and automated with strong visibility across systems. This enables predictable delivery, lower operational cost, and rapid recovery from issues.

ITSM.Foundational: Service processes are informal or inconsistently followed, leading to delays and user frustration. Formalising workflows will reduce friction, improve service quality, and prevent avoidable escalations.
ITSM.Developing: Core ITSM processes exist but adoption varies across teams. Strengthening consistency will reduce rework, improve user satisfaction, and lower operational overhead.
ITSM.Established: Service management is functional but still relies on manual steps and limited automation. Expanding automation and ESM practices will reduce handling time and increase overall efficiency.
ITSM.Advanced: Service delivery is well-defined and increasingly automated, but cross-team alignment is not yet seamless. Unifying workflows will reduce bottlenecks and accelerate business outcomes.
ITSM.Optimised: Service operations are fully automated and experience-driven with strong analytics. This improves user productivity, reduces operating cost, and enables continuous service improvement.

SECURITY.Foundational: Security controls are incomplete or inconsistently enforced, exposing the organisation to high risk. Improving baseline protection will reduce likelihood of compromise and lower incident impact.
SECURITY.Developing: Core security controls exist but coverage gaps and manual processes persist. Increasing consistency and integration will reduce reactive work and strengthen overall security posture.
SECURITY.Established: Security is well-managed but relies on manual monitoring and slow response cycles. Introducing automation will reduce detection time, shrink risk exposure, and improve operational resilience.
SECURITY.Advanced: Security operations are mature but still require manual effort for correlation and response. Enhancing automation and intelligence will reduce response cost and prevent high-impact incidents.
SECURITY.Optimised: Security is fully integrated, automated, and intelligence-led. This minimises risk exposure, reduces operational burden, and enables rapid, predictable response to emerging threats.

GOVERNANCE.Foundational: Governance and compliance processes are informal or incomplete, creating blind spots in risk and accountability. Establishing structured governance will reduce compliance exposure and improve transparency.
GOVERNANCE.Developing: Governance frameworks exist but are inconsistently maintained or manually executed. Improving alignment and automation will reduce audit effort and ensure reliable risk management.
GOVERNANCE.Established: Governance is structured but relies on periodic reviews and manual evidence gathering. Increasing automation will lower audit cost, strengthen assurance, and reduce business disruption.
GOVERNANCE.Advanced: Governance is strong but not fully continuous, creating reporting delays and inefficiencies. Moving to continuous compliance will reduce risk, accelerate decision-making, and support strategic planning.
GOVERNANCE.Optimised: Governance is fully automated with real-time assurance and aligned strategic planning. This minimises compliance cost, strengthens risk oversight, and improves organisational resilience.
